intro: Panargyrus heterophyllum, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Its leaves are leathery and elliptical, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Panargyrus heterophyllum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
